e4: Adopting the new policy enhances transparency and trustworthiness in financial reporting, aligning with legal and ethical standards. Although there's a risk of temporary confusion among investors, thorough communication strategies can mitigate misunderstandings. This forward-looking approach reduces legal risks and ultimately fosters a healthier relationship with all shareholders, benefiting the company's long-term reputation and credibility.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should be transparent, accurate, and honest, providing all investors with the true financial health of the company without any intentional biases or manipulations. It should comply with legal and regulatory frameworks, respect investor rights, and equitably present information to avoid giving undue advantage to any group of investors. Effective communication about any policy changes is crucial to maintain trust and manage expectations, ensuring all stakeholders are equally informed and can make decisions based on accurate and comprehensible financial data.
e6: Yes, I would inquire about the specific strategies planned to effectively communicate the switch to the new policy to all investors including those less sophisticated. Additionally, I would ask for a detailed risk assessment regarding the initial market reaction and long-term impacts on stock price and investor relations. Understanding the management team’s projections on how the change could affect future equity raises and investor sentiment is also critical.
